TI: [Interrelations between biopotentials of the neocortex, archicortex and intermediate cortex during formation of conditioned reflexes to time].
AB: By means of instrumental food-procuring technique in chronic experiments on dogs, it was shown that during formation of the reflex to time, two complexly interacting systems of bioelectrical activity appear in the EEG in the form of rapid 28-32 c/s spindles in the neocortex (motor and parietal cortex) and slow (4-7 c/s) activity in the hippocampus and entorhinal cortex. The involvement of both structures in the mechanisms of voluntary activity is analyzed.
TT: Vzaimootnosheniia biopotentsialov neokorteksa, arkhikorteksa i mezhutochnoi kory pri formirovanii uslovnogo refleksa na vremia.
TA: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova
JT: Zhurnal vysshei nervnoi deiatelnosti imeni I P Pavlova
SO: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova. 1981 May-Jun;31(3):489-96.
